title: What should I do, I am 25 years old and still haven't got a degree. Should I pursue a degree for 4 years or work? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you don't know why you want a specific degree yet, perhaps getting all of the general requirements finished at a community college while you work is an option? We don't have enough information about you to really give specific advice. A degree can be great for many older students. You are not even “older" yet. Are you single with no kids and no debt? Are you married, the sole adult working and parent to multiple kids? Debt or other obligations is a big factor. Do you have any college courses completed or will it all be new to you after being out of high school for 5 or 6 years? I don't advocate getting a general sort of liberal arts degree just to say that you have one. People can end up with huge student loans and nothing practical to show for it. I do believe that for people who don't want to learned a skilled trade that a college education can improve lifetime earning potential if one gets the correct degree. Think about what career you want and get the knowledge and any skills necessary to pursue that path when choosing a degree program.

Medical speaking your body is just peak at age 25. I in my opinion is join up and get paid at the same time. 1st. Air force, 2nd Navy, 3rd Army. 4th Coast Guard. After your get thru basic training and pass all the written test then you go to school, Computers, Air Controller, Fixings Airplanes. You may be able to stay in and get your degree to. I think you should work hard and so they would kick you out. Your life will become so much better. Or go to school a learn how repairs automobiles. Then go get to school at night and get a college education. Needed if you want to be a white collar wage earner with a high income source. And you could take a test that will tell you what fields you are currently best suited for. Have a good life. Work the job that makes you want to get out bed and go to work. Also in this day and age, you can switch fields and do something else that you thought you would to try.
